body_content.explanation: a mental health condition that affects someone's moods, so that they can sometimes feel very depressed (= sad and without hope or energy) and at other times very excited and energetic:
examples: She has been diagnosed with bipolar affective disorder and is now being successfully treated, which has made a huge difference to her life.
Lithium has been the standard therapy for bipolar affective disorder for more than three decades.
Two of the depressed patients had a bipolar affective disorder.
